summary: ADSR envelope generator, can be connected to an Audio Port

ports.name: Attack
ports.text: When triggerAttack is called, the attack time is the amount of time it takes for the envelope to reach it's maximum value.

ports.name: Decay
ports.text: After the attack portion of the envelope, the value will fall over the duration of the decay time to it's sustain value.

ports.name: Sustain
ports.text: The sustain value is the value which the envelope rests at after triggerAttack is called, but before triggerRelease is invoked.

ports.name: Release
ports.text: After triggerRelease is called, the envelope's value will fall to it's miminum value over the duration of the release time.

ports.name: Trigger Attack
ports.text: Trigger the attack/decay portion of the ADSR envelope.

ports.name: Velocity
ports.text: How loud the attack will be triggered (`0` = quiet, `1` = loud)

ports.name: Attack Time
ports.text: When `Trigger Attack` is triggered this is the time when it actually happens, `+0` means *now*, `+2` means in two seconds from now

ports.name: Trigger Release
ports.text: Triggers the release of the envelope.

ports.name: Release Time
ports.text: When `Trigger Release` is triggered this is the time when it actually happens, `+0` means *now*, `+2` means in two seconds from now

ports.name: Signal
ports.text: Can be connected to a dynamic audio param port

ports.name: Envelope Object
ports.text: Can be connected to an envelope-port of a synth
